articles.author: Ashley Strickland
articles.title: Juice mission launches to explore Jupiter's icy ocean worlds - CNN
articles.description: The European Space Agency is sending a spacecraft to explore Jupiter and three of its largest and most intriguing moons. The Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer mission, or Juice, launched on Friday at 8:14 a.m ET.

articles.title: European Space Agency: Blast off for Jupiter icy moons mission - BBC
articles.description: A £1.4bn space probe leaves Earth to study the possibilities for life in the outer Solar System.
articles.content:
Europe's mission to the icy moons of Jupiter has blasted away from Earth.
The Juice satellite was sent skyward on an Ariane-5 rocket from the Kourou spaceport in French Guiana.

articles.title: The hunt for life on Jupiter's icy moons - The Economist
articles.description: Our podcast on science and technology. This week, our second episode on the hunt for life elsewhere—exploring the European Space Agency’s JUICE mission
